body_html:
I am not sure, if the freeze_graph works with input_fn, and estimators. So, it could be a bug. I have posted on StackOverflow before posting here. I also found other people facing similar problems on StackOverflow without any solution. Alternatively, the feature request is to prevent predict_scores() for estimators to not reload graph weights from checkpoint file everytime (or after first call) to make it faster. This will allow faster test time models without going into Tensorflow serving

Thanks.

body:
I am not sure, if the freeze_graph works with input_fn, and estimators. So, it could be a bug. I have posted on StackOverflow before posting here. I also found other people facing similar problems on StackOverflow without any solution. Alternatively, the feature request is to prevent predict_scores() for estimators to not reload graph weights from checkpoint file everytime (or after first call) to make it faster. This will allow faster test time models without going into Tensorflow serving

Thanks.
